xhtml.p: What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • hypercholesterolemia
  • overweight
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Biochemistry of lipid and glycolipid metabolism
  • Pharmacology of lipid-lowering drugs
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Obtain a fasting lipid profile (total chosterol, low- and high-density cholesterol, triglycerides), fasting serum glucose, thyroid stimulating hormone, liver function tests just prior to return visit in 6 weeks.
  • Provide education on the risks of elevated cholesterol and a plan to lower those risks (lifestyle changes and lipid-lowering drugs).
  • Prescribe lifestyle changes to reduce cholesterol and risk of cardiac disease, including dietary changes to lose weight and lower saturated fat and cholesterol in diet and exercise.
What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • No new problems
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Pharmacology of lipid-lowering drugs
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Discuss the advisability of beginning a lipid-lowering drug while continuing her lifestyle changes.
  • Return visit in 6 weeks and repeat lipid profile just prior to next visit.
  • Repeat liver function tests prior to next visit if drug therapy initiated.
What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • No new problems
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Pharmacology of lipid-lowering drugs
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Double the dose of the atorvastatin
  • Return visit in 12 weeks and repeat lipid profile and liver function tests just prior to next visit.
What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • Acute cholecystitis
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Gall bladder and biliary tree anatomy
  • Gall bladder physiology (explain how the gall bladder is stimulated to contract)
  • Pathophysiology of cholelithiasis and cholecystitis (why do gallstones form?)
  • What are the risk factors for developing gallbladder disease?
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Referral to a surgeon for cholcystectomy
  • Pain relief with intravenous analgesics
  • Administration of antibiotics
  • Intravenous fluids
In addition to being status post cholecystectomy, what other problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • Ileus
  • Fever
  • Impaired sensorium
  • Hypotension or you could have subsumed the fever, impaired sensorium, and hypotension under the problem of septic shock syndrome
  • Malnutrition
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Pathophysiology of septic shock syndrome
  • Microbiology of bacteroides and other anaerobes
  • Pharmacology of clindamycin
  • Natural history of septic shock
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Obtain a computerized tomogram of the abdomen
  • Obtain blood cultures, urine cultures
  • Start on multiple antibiotic regimen that covers Gram negative aerobic bacteria and anaerobic bacteria
  • Begin parenteral nutritional support
  • Transfer patient to intensive care unit for close monitoring
In addition to being status post cholecystectomy and laparotomy for abdominal abscess and bowel perforation, what other problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • pseudomembranous colitis (or at this level of your training, you may only be confident in saying that the patient has diarrhea associated with fever, leucocytosis, fecal leucocytes, and toxins A and B)
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Pathophysiology of pseudomembranous colitis
  • Pathology of pseudomembranous colitis
  • Pharmacology of vancomycin
  • Microbiology of Clostridium difficile
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Ms. Cosby.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Discontinue the clindamycin
  • Begin on oral metronidazole
  • Maintain fluids, continue oral feedings as tolerated
